links.title: 3 22 18 - Market Update: Looking Weak
links.description: Market Update: Looking Weak. With the Fed's Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) statement, we saw that rates are being increased. Market reaction was volatile touching above $273 on the SPY but ultimately closing below $270.50. If $270 doesn't hold there could be a lot of downside as indicators are looking bearish, but a bounce here is still possible.

links.title: Bigfry's Blog
links.description: Did you know that American options and European options differ in that American options can be exercised anytime before the expiration date, whereas European options can only be exercised at the expiration date? This means European options are cheaper than American options because American options have more options (pun intended).

links.title: IBM And Apple Team Up To Eliminate AI Roadblocks With New Watson Services
links.description: Apple and IBM revealed an enhancement to their existing collaboration at the Think 2018 conference with Watson Services for Core ML and the newly designed IBM Cloud Developer Console for Apple. The offering marries Apple's Core ML tools for developers with IBM's Watson to make it easier for companies to add artificial intelligence into mobile applications.
